contentList:
Magus Class Description The Magus is at once a student of two philosophies, blending magical ability and martial prowess into something entirely unique, a discipline in which both spell and steel are used to devastating effect. Sparkling Targe You’ve studied the applications of magic, training yourself to perform not just offensive maneuvers but defensive tactics as well. When magic flows through you, your shield can block impossible things, even a dragon’s breath or a magic missile. Inexorable Iron Once you begin along a path, nothing can stop you from reaching its end. You transform the mass of a greataxe, greatsword, or polearm into an unstoppable force to augment your own striking power or keep you standing on the battlefield. Laughing Shadow Magic is freeing, a means to your ends, and you can use it to go where you want, do as you please, and avoid the consequences. You are a laughing shadow of spell and blade, always one step ahead of your foes, always with a trick up your sleeve. Starlit Span With magic, the sky’s the limit, and you can’t be bound by the confines of physical proximity. Your power reaches as far as your senses can perceive, transcending the space between you and your target even with spells that normally require direct physical contact. Twisting Tree The staff is perhaps one of the simplest of weapons, but this simplicity belies its elegance and versatility. To you, a staff is casting implement and martial weapon alike—the foundation of a fighting style. Arcane Enhancement Class Features You can expend 1 Arcane Point as a bonus action to change your weapon's damage type to Fire, Cold, Acid, Lightning, or Thunder for 1 minute, and at level 5, you may spend additional Arcane Points to increase its duration further. Fire Enhancement Convert your weapon damage to [1] Cold Enhancement Acid Enhancement Lightning Enhancement Thunder Enhancement Devastating Spell Strike Spend 1 Arcane Point, make a weapon attack, and unleash an explosion around your target based on your Arcane Cascade's damage die. Distracting Spell Strike Spend 1 Arcane Point, make a weapon attack to disrupt your spell-stricken target's balance. Gain Deception proficiency, using Intelligence instead of Charisma. You may spend 1 Arcane Pool Point to have your spellstrike potentially knock a target off balance. Cascading Ray After a Spellstrike with a leveled spell, spend 1 Arcane Pool point to channel the energy into a ray attack against another creature within 60 feet, dealing damage matching your Arcane Cascade's type. Revitalize You release the power of your Spellstrike to heal yourself for 5 times the spell's level. Twisted Staff Transform your staff with your Arcane Cascade, increasing its damage to 1d8 and gaining the Reach property. Student of the Staff - Shove Make a melee attack and push your target 10 feet away. Spell Parry Infuse magical power into your body or armaments to parry both physical and magical attacks, gaining a +5 AC bonus as a reaction. Arcane Accuracy Spend 1 point from your Arcane Pool as a bonus action to grant your weapon attacks a +2 bonus to attack rolls until the end of your turn. Body of Mist Teleport 30ft to a visible, unoccupied space as a bonus action. Cascade Countermeasure Cast Counterspell at 3rd level as a reaction for 3 Arcane Points Arcane Strike Your magic guides your blades to bypass slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing damage resistances and immunities for 2 Arcane Pool Points. Emegency Targe Raise your shield to gain resistance and temporary hit points against incoming attacks. Arcane Restoration Once per short rest, recover Arcane Pool Points equal to your Intelligence modifier. Rapid Recharge Once per encounter, recover half of your Intelligence modifier in Arcane Pool Points. Extended Spell Strike When you cast a spell, your store a part of the magic within you blade and your next spell does not consume a spell slot. Spell Swipe Swing your weapon in a wide arc to attack up to [1] enemies simultaneously. Whirlwind Spell Spend 2 Arcane Pool Points as a Spellstrike to attack all enemies within your reach simultaneously. Dazzling Block When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Arcane Pool Point to create a blinding flash in a 15-foot cone, potentially blinding multiple enemies. Thundering Retaliation When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Arcane Pool Point to create a thundering blast to knock away attackers as a reaction. Vacuum Tunnel Charge forward, pulling objects and creatures in your path [1] toward you. Magus's Analysis - True Strike As a bonus action, you cast true strike, granting you advantage for your next attack against the target. Meteoric Shot Leave a trail of unstable energy following your arrow, dealing damage based on your Arcane Cascade. Capture Magic - Abjuration and Evocation Capture Magic - Conjuration and Transmutation Capture Magic - Divination, Illusion, and Enchantment Capture Magic - Necromancy You have captured another's magic to enter Arcane Cascade. Runic Impression - Bloodthisty Blood Thirsty: When you hit a creature, you regain 1d4 hit points. Runic Impression - Speed Speed: You can make one attack with this weapon as a bonus action for half damage. Runic Impression - Deathdrinking Death Drinking: When you kill a creature, you regain 2d8 hit points. Runic Impression - Wounding Wounding: when you strike a creature, they bleed and take 1d6 damage at the start of their turns for the next 10 turns. Runic Impression - Hooked Hooked: You may make Topple attacks with your weapon. Elemental Blade Acid Elemental Blade Cold Elemental Blade Fire Elemental Blade Lightning Your weapon attacks deal an additional 1d6 elemental damage. Charge of the Magi You charge forward for 30ft, as a bonus action. Stoneskin Turn the flesh of a creature you touch as hard as stone, granting the target resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Blink At the end of your turns, you have a chance to vanish from your plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane. While in the Ethereal Plane, at the start of your turn or when the spell ends, return to a space within [1] of your previous space. Greater Invisibility Touch a creature to turn it Invisible. Fire Shield Flames wreathe your body, shedding light in a [1] radius and granting a warm or chill shield as you choose. The warm shield grants you resistance to cold damage and the chill shield grants you resistance to fire damage. Whenever a creature within [2] of you hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes [3] from a warm shield or [4] from a cold shield. False Life (3) Bolster yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life to gain 1d4 + 14 Temporary Hit Points. Far Step Teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. You can teleport in this way again as a bonus action on your turns. Hasted Assault You can take one additional action, which must be either the Attack (one weapon attack), Dash, Disengage or Dash actions. Bane Blade Weapon Attack that reduces the target's attack, and saving throws by [1] for the next minute. Arcane Cloak Spell Strike You know how to channel a melee attack spell into a punch or sword thrust to deliver a combined attack. Spell Combat When you take the attack action, you may make also make a spell strike Spell Strike - Ranged You know how to channel a spell into a punch or sword thrust to deliver a combined attack. Arcane Enhancement You gain a + [1] bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls for the duration Arcane Cascade You divert a portion of the spell’s magical power and keep it cycling through your body and weapon using specialized forms, breathing, or footwork. When you cast a spell or use a spell strike with a spell of 1st level or higher, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d4 point of damage depends on the school of the spell which increases to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, 1d10 at level 14, and 1d12 at level 17. Sneak Attack You gain 1 Sneak Attack Die Menacing Attack You gain 1 SuperiorityDie Die and one Battle Master maneuver. Pushing Attack You gain 1 SuperiorityDie Die and one Battle Master maneuver. Rally You gain 1 SuperiorityDie Die and one Battle Master maneuver. Riposte You gain 1 SuperiorityDie Die and one Battle Master maneuver. Trip Attack You gain 1 SuperiorityDie Die and one Battle Master maneuver. Disarming Attack You gain 1 SuperiorityDie Die and one Battle Master maneuver. Extra Spell Slots - Level 1 Extra Spell Slots - Level 2 You gain 1 additional level 1 spell slot You gain 1 additional level 2 spell slot True-Magus Strength Saving Throw As a pinnacle of magical and martial capability, you gain proficiency in Strength Saving throw True-Magus Dexterity Saving Throw As a pinnacle of magical and martial capability, you gain proficiency in Dexterity Saving throw True-Magus Wisdom Saving Throw As a pinnacle of magical and martial capability, you gain proficiency in Wisdom Saving throw True-Magus Charisma Saving Throw As a pinnacle of magical and martial capability, you gain proficiency in Charisma Saving throw True-Magus UnerringSpellStrike As a pinnacle of magical and martial capability, When you miss a spellstrike, you may spend 5 Arcane Points and choose to hit instead Medium Armor Proficiency You gain proficiency with Medium Armor Shield Proficiency You gain proficiency with shields Arcane Cascade Augmentation While you’re in Arcane Cascade stance and wielding a shield, you take [1] less damage from all sources. While you’re in Arcane Cascade stance, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence Modifier. While you’re in Arcane Cascade stance, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your Intelligence Modifier. While you’re in Arcane Cascade stance, you gain 5ft of extra movement, and you deal double damage with Arcane Cascade. While you’re in Arcane Cascade stance, your staff deals 1d10 bludgeoning damage instead and gains the Reach property. Familiar You learn the spell Find Familiar. Magic Sense You learn the spell Detect Magic. Raise a Tome You may summon a magical Tome that acts like a shield and grant you advantage in all intelligence checks. You are considered Proficient with shields summoned this way. Summon Tome - Arcane Grimore. Summon an Arcane Grimore that acts like a shield and grant you advantage in all intelligence checks. Summon Tome - Shield. Summon a magical tome that grant you 1 casting of the shield spell. Summon Tome - Absorb Element. Summon a magical tome that grant you 1 casting of the absorb element spell. Summon Tome - Riposte. Summon a magical tome that you can use your reaction to shield bash. Summon Tome - Emergency Shielding. Summon a magical tome that grant you temporary Hit points when you are on lower health. Summon Tome - Resilience. Summon a magical tome that grant you a saving throw bonus. Tome of Shielding. Tome of Shielding +1. Tome of Shielding +2. A tome that grant you 1 casting of shield. Tome of Elemental Absorbtion. Tome of Elemental Absorbtion +1. Tome of Elemental Absorbtion +2. A tome that grant you 1 casting of Absorb Element. Arcane Grimoire While you are holding this leather-bound book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your wizard spells. The bonus is determined by the book's rarity. Shield of Bashing Shield of Bashing +1 While you are holding this tome, you may use an reaction to bash a creature attacking you. Shield of Emergency Shielding Shield of Emergency Shielding +1 Shield of Emergency Shielding +2 While you are holding this tome, you gain temporary hit points when you drop to low health Emergency Shielding When your hit points drop below 50% you gain [1]. Tome of Resilience Tome of Resilience +1 Tome of Resilience +2 While you are holding this tome, you gain a bonus saving throws. Magical Resilience You gain a +[1] to saving throws.
Magus's Analysis Your training allows you to analyze any situation with your intellect. You gain a bonus to Insight and Perception equal to your Intelligence Modifier. In addition, you may cast True Strike as a Bonus Action. Expansive Spell Strike You’ve adapted a wider array of spells to work with your attacks. You no longer require a spell or spell effect to involve a spell attack roll to Spellstrike. Spell Parry You can cast shield using an Arcane Point instead of a spell slot Arcane Accuracy As a bonus action, spending 1 Arcane Point, gain a +2 bonus to your attack rolls until the end of your turn Steady Spellcasting You gain a bonus to concentration checks equal to your intelligence modifier Devastating Spell Strike You spend 1 Arcane Point and cause an explosion that deals 1d4 force damage around your spell striked foe. this damage increases to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, 1d10 at level 14, and 1d12 at level 17 Distracting Spell Strike Spending 1 Arcane Points, you attempt to throw your target off balance with your Spellstrike. Starlit Eyes You gain blindsight. Emergency Targe As a reaction upon hit, you gain resistance to the damage taken, as well as Temporary HP until start of your next turn. You learn the spell misty step and can cast it with an Arcane Point instead of a spell slot Student of the Staff You’ve studied the staff extensively to learn the hidden capabilities of your chosen weapon. When you critically strike with a staff, you deal an additional die of damage of the same type of your Arcane Cascade stance, in addition, you may knock your target up to 10 feet away from you. Knowledge is power You can add your Intelligence modifier to your weapon damage Shielded Tome When you are wielding a shield, you increase the shield's AC and saving throws by 1 Enduring Blade You may spend extra Arcane Points to extend the duration of your Arcane Enhancement, up to 8 hours. Arcane Strike Your magic guides your blades to the weak points of your foes. As a bonus action, you may expend 3 Arcane points and gain advantage in all attack rolls until the end of your turn. Arcane Cloak You gain a bonus to stealth, deception, and persuation check equal to your intelligence modifier. In addition, you may hide as a bonus action. Spell Swipe When you make a Spellstrike with a leveled spell, you may spend 1 Arcane Point to attack two creatures within 5 feet of each other. Capture Magic When a spell is casted on you and specifically targets you, you capture some of its magic for your own use. You enter your Arcane Cascade stance, using the triggering spell to determine what damage type your Arcane Cascade deals. In addition, you recover 1 Focus Point. Cascading Ray Magical energy spills out to extend beyond the creature you struck. When you have struck a creature with your spellstrike, you may spend 1 Arcane Point to make a ranged spell attack against another target within 60ft. On hit, the creature takes force damage equal to two rolls of your Arcane Cascade. Dimensional Disappearance You take advantage of teleportation to better hide your position. When you cast Misty Step, Body of Mist, Thunderstep, Dimension Door, or Far step, you become Invisible for 1 hour at end of the teleport. In addition, this invisibility can not be broken for the first turn it is applied. Dazzling Block When targeted by an attack, you can use your Reaction and spend 1 Arcane Point create a brilliant flash and attempt to blind those around you. Meteoric Shot When you make a Spell Strike, you may spend 2 Arcane Points and create a trail of arcane energy to damage all along the way. The damage uses your Arcane Cascade Die. Sustaining Steel When you enter Arcane Cascade, you gain double the Temporary Hit Points. Runic Impression you can expend 1 Arcane Point as a bonus action to grant any one melee weapon you are holding an additional property for the duration of your arcane enhancement. Lunging Spellstrike You may extend your touch spells to a range of 30ft. Elemental Burst When you use Arcane Enhancement, your weapon gains an additional 1d8 damage of that damage type, which increases to 1d10 at 14th level and 1d12 at 17th level. In addition, when you critically hit with a weapon attack, you create an elemental explosion dealing the bonus damage to surrounding creatures within 5ft. Charge of the Magi As a bonus action, charge forward, pulling objects and creatures in your path [1] toward you. Rapid Recharge As a bonus action once per combat encounter, recover Arcane Pool Points equal to half your Intelligence modifier. You gain a + [1] bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls. Arcane Cascade Temporary HP Magus Unlock Tadpole Power Resounding Cascade Gain a 10-foot aura of magical energy. Allies within your aura gain extra damage from your Arcane Cascade, with multiple Resounding Cascades not stacking on the same creature. Arcane Shroud Upon triggering your Arcane Cascade, briefly gain a spell depending on the school of spell that triggered it. Hasted Assault You may spend 2 Arcane points to gain an additional action. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action. Preternatural Parry Perform a counterattack when using Spell Parry. Spell Blending Cantrips - Druid You learn 2 Druid Cantrips Spell Blending Cantrips - Cleric You learn 2 Cleric Cantrips Spell Blending Cantrips - Bard You learn 2 Bard Cantrips Spell Blending Cantrips - Warlock You learn 2 Warlock Cantrips Spell Blending 1st Level Spells - Ranger You learn 2 Ranger spells of 1st level Spell Blending 1st Level Spells - Druid You learn 2 Druid spells of 1st level - Druid Spell Blending 1st Level Spells - Cleric You learn 2 Cleric spells of 1st level Spell Blending 1st Level Spells - Paladin You learn 2 Paladin spells of 1st level Spell Blending 1st Level Spells - Warlock You learn 2 Warlock spells of 1st level Spell Blending 1st Level Spells - Bard You learn 2 Bard spells of 1st level You learn the Spell VacuumTunnel Arcane Points A reservoir of mystical arcane energy that fuels your powers and enhances your weapon. Spellstrike This spell's attack roll and range match your melee weapon's attack roll. Ranged Spellstrike This spell's attack roll and range match your ranged weapon's attack roll. This attack is part of a Spellstrike. A Spellsword who wields both the arcane and the blade Magus Dimensional Assault Tumble through space, making a short dimensional hop to better position yourself for an attack. Teleport to near a creature in range and attack it. Conflux Focus The resource for casting conflux spells, can be replenished out of combat. Conflux Refocus Spend 10 minutes to regain your conflux focus point. Spinning Staff Spin your staff around, flinging every foe within 10 feet of you away. Shielding Strike Thrust your shield forward and taunt your foe, gaining a +2 bonus to Armor Class and Saving Throws. Thundering Strike You slam your weapon onto a foe, potentially knocking it and nearby foes prone. Shooting Star Plunge an arrow into a foe, lighting it up with faerie fire. Elemental Burst Attack with your weapon and create a burst of elemental energy. Supreme Spellstrike You always gain the benefit of Hasted Assault. Conflux Wellspring Casting any leveled spell replenishes 1 Conflux Focus Point. Magus's Smite Smite your target for an additional [1]. Shielding Strike AC You gain +[1] to AC and Saving Throws. Shooting Star Advantage Attacks against this target have advantage. Elemental Eruption Your elemental burst now trigger on every weapon attack, and its radius is increased to 10ft. Overwhelming Spell Strike spend 2 AP to ignore all resistances to damage for 1 turn Expanded Cascade In addition to your cascade damage, you also extend your hybrid study's casacde augmentation effect to your allies. Hasted Actions Disengage, Dash, Hide, or Attack. Resonant Blades When you miss a spellstrike with you main hand weapon, you may attempt another spellstrike as a bonus action with your offhand weapon. Missing the attack part of an Expansive Spellstrike would not trigger this. Resonant Blade SpellStrike Make a spellstrike as a bonus action with your offhand weapon. Extended Spell Your next cast of a spell does not cost a spell slot.
